name: jquery-radar
tagline: A jQuery plugin providing a radar sweep animation.
body:
## jQuery-Radar A jQuery plugin providing a radar sweep animation. Provides the ability to publish X/Y coordinate points for them to appear within the radar sweep animation. ## Dependencies The plugin is dependent upon [jQuery](http://jquery.com) and [Underscore](http://underscorejs.org). ## Usage Include the radar CSS and JavaScript files within your page in addition to the dependency script files: ```html ``` ### HTML A default radar; simply assign the _radar_ CSS class to an HTML element. The default size is 320px width / 320px height. ```html
``` Or... Specify a height/width different from the default. ```html
``` ### JavaScript ```javascript $(function() { var radars = $(".radar").radar().each(function() { var points = [ { X: 33.73834818019053, Y: 17.133526305855796 }, { X: 41.04449004559928, Y: 23.090547816002868 }, { X: 53.450948245470364, Y: 58.23568471317653 } ]; $(this).data("radar").updatePoints(points); }); }); ``` ## Authors and Contributors Jason Fuehner (@jfuehner)
